New Records: Mohammad Rizwan equalled Babar Azam's record as the fastest man to 2000 T20I runs.
Key Match Events: Alex Hales made a half-century on his first England appearance in more than three years, scoring 53 off 40 balls.
Harry Brook scored an unbeaten 42 from 25 balls, including the winning hit over extra cover.
Luke Wood took 3 wickets for 24 runs on his debut.
Mohammad Rizwan top-scored for Pakistan with 68 from 46 balls.
Iftikhar Ahmed hit three sixes in his 28 from 17 balls.
Adil Rashid dismissed Babar Azam with a googly.
Sam Curran took the wicket of Haider Ali.
Pre-Game Insights: There was speculation that Mohammad Rizwan might be rested to allow Shan Masood to open and Mohammad Haris to take the gloves.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played under the Karachi floodlights.
England won by 6 wickets with 4 balls remaining.
Pakistan's top three batsmen made 69% of the team's runs, facing 69% of the balls.
